goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog.trans

Class PrologEquals

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog.trans.PrologEquals

  • public class PrologEquals
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for determining whether two atoms are equal in a possibly over-approximative fashion. Three types of equality are distinguished:
    • Functor equality: two atoms are functor equal if their functor is equal.
    • Signature equality: two atoms are signature equal if their signature is equal.
    • Theta equality: two atoms are theta equal if they can be unified.
    Note that if two atoms are theta equal, they are signature equal, and that if two atoms are signature equal, they are functor equal.
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Method Detail

      • areEqual

        public static Substitution areEqual(jpl.Atom atomX,
                    jpl.Atom atomY)
        Determines whether atomX and atomY are equal under the type of equality as specified by type. If so, this method returns the substitution that unifies atomX and atomY, where the empty substitution may indicate either that the two atoms are ground and equal, or that the equality specified by type does not require unification of the atoms to be deemed equal (hence it over-approximates the equality relation). If the atoms are not deemed equal, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        atomX - - The left-hand side (though the method is commutative).
        atomY - - The right-hand side (though the method is commutative).
        Returns:
        null if the atoms are not deemed equal; a Substitution otherwise.

      • areDisjoint

        public static java.util.List<Substitution> areDisjoint(LMHashSet<jpl.Atom> setX,
                                       LMHashSet<jpl.Atom> setY)
        Determines whether setX contains an element that is equal, according to areEqual(jpl.Atom, jpl.Atom), to an element in setY. If no common element is found, this method returns an empty list. Otherwise, the list contains a Substitution for each two atoms in setX and setY that are deemed equal.
        Parameters:
        setX - - The left-hand side (though the method is commutative).
        setY - - The right-hand side (though the method is commutative).
        Returns:
        An empty ArrayList if setX and setY do not have a common element, and an ArrayList containing at least one Substitution otherwise.

      • useFunctorEquality

        public static void useFunctorEquality()
        Set the required type of equality to functor equality.

      • useSignatureEquality

        public static void useSignatureEquality()
        Set the required type of equality to signature equality.

      • useThetaEquality

        public static void useThetaEquality()
        Set the required type of equality to theta equality.
